intro: Astrapaea speciosa, commonly known as the showy moonflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night and close during the day. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its leaves are heart-shaped and velvety, while its stems are hairy and woody. The showy moonflower is often cultivated for its ornamental value and nocturnal blooming habit.
